name: ManageRemoteIIS
description: Manages IIS resources on remote machine
author: automagically
helpMarkDown: Manages IIS resources on remote machine

inputs.name: remoteServer
inputs.label: Remote server
inputs.helpMarkDown: Remote server name or comma separated list of remote server names

inputs.name: remoteUserName
inputs.label: Remote username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Username of user on remote computer.

inputs.name: remoteUserPassword
inputs.label: Remote user password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password of the user on remote computer.

inputs.name: remoteWinRMProtocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the network protocol to use for the WinRM connection with the machine(s). The default is HTTP.

inputs.name: Name
inputs.label: Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: IIS resource name (website, web app, app pool, virtual directory

inputs.name: physicalPath
inputs.label: Physical path
inputs.visibleRule: action = createWebsite || action = configureWebsite || action = createWebapp || action = configureWebapp || action = createVirtualdir || action = configureVirtualdir

inputs.name: parentWebsite
inputs.label: IIS Parent website
inputs.visibleRule: action = createWebapp || action = configureWebapp || action = createVirtualdir || action = configureVirtualdir || action = deleteWebapp || action = deleteVirtualdir

inputs.name: pathUnderParentWebsite
inputs.label: Path under parent website
inputs.visibleRule: action = createWebapp || action = configureWebapp || action = createVirtualdir || action = configureVirtualdir || action = deleteWebapp || action = deleteVirtualdir

inputs.name: webAppPoolName
inputs.label: Application pool
inputs.visibleRule: action = createWebsite || action = configureWebsite || action = createWebapp || action = configureWebapp

inputs.name: DotNetVersion
inputs.label: .NET Version
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the version of the .NET Framework that is loaded by the application pool.
If the applications assigned to this application pool do not contain managed code, then select the 'No Managed Code' option from the list.

inputs.name: PipeLineMode
inputs.label: Managed Pipeline Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the managed pipeline mode that specifies how IIS processes requests for managed content. Use classic mode only when the applications in the application pool cannot run in the Integrated mode.

inputs.name: AppPoolIdentity
inputs.label: Identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Configure the account under which an application pool's worker process runs. Select one of the predefined security accounts or configure a custom account.

inputs.name: AppPoolPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you are using a gMSA, this is not required.
